title: FitVerse AI — Futuristic AI Fashion E-Commerce Platform

requirements.text: Apply a glassmorphism UI design system with soft purple, neon blue, and pink gradient accents throughout the entire app. Use animated particle/gradient mesh backgrounds, rounded corners, soft glowing shadows, clean futuristic typography, and a premium Apple + AI startup aesthetic. All buttons must have floating glow effects and micro-animations on hover. Page transitions must be smooth and fluid.

quotes: Ultra-modern AI SaaS aesthetic
Glassmorphism UI
Soft purple, neon blue and pink gradient accents
Smooth animations and hover effects
Floating glowing buttons
Animated background particles or gradient mesh
Premium startup feel (like Apple + AI startup combined)

acceptanceCriteria: All pages render with glassmorphism card/panel styles (frosted glass effect with blur and translucency)
Background shows animated gradient mesh or particle effect on all pages
Buttons glow and scale on hover with smooth transitions
Typography feels futuristic and clean (e.g., sharp sans-serif with gradient text accents)
Color palette consistently uses purple, neon blue, and pink gradients
Page-to-page transitions use smooth fade or slide animations

requirements.text: Create a floating animated sidebar navigation component that appears on all pages (except the landing page hero) with links to: Landing, Shop, Trial Hub, Body Scan AI, and Wardrobe AI. The sidebar must have micro-animations on each nav item hover and a glowing active indicator.

quotes: Floating animated sidebar
Smooth transitions between pages
Micro-animations on buttons

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar floats on screen and is visible across all pages
Each nav item highlights with a neon glow on hover
Active page is clearly indicated with a glowing accent
Sidebar collapses to icons on narrow viewports
Navigation between all 5 pages works correctly

requirements.text: Build the Landing Page with: hero headline 'Shop Smart. Try Smart. Dress Smart.', a subheadline describing the AI-powered trial hub, body scan, and wardrobe intelligence features, three CTA buttons ('Start Shopping', 'Scan My Body', 'Scan My Wardrobe'), and an animated AI avatar illustration of a digital figure trying on clothes. Clicking 'Start Shopping' navigates to the Shop page, 'Scan My Body' navigates to the Body Scan AI page, and 'Scan My Wardrobe' navigates to the Wardrobe AI page.

quotes: Hero headline: 'Shop Smart. Try Smart. Dress Smart.'
Subheadline explaining AI-powered trial hub + body scan + wardrobe intelligence
Animated AI illustration of a digital avatar trying clothes

acceptanceCriteria: Hero headline renders prominently with gradient text styling
Subheadline is concise and clearly communicates three AI features
All three CTA buttons navigate to the correct pages
Animated avatar illustration plays continuously (CSS or JS animation)
Landing page has no sidebar or uses a minimal top nav variant

requirements.text: Build the Shop Page with a product grid containing at least 10 mock products across categories: T-shirts, Jeans, Tops, Kurtas, and Dresses. Each product card must display: product image, name, price, size selector (XS/S/M/L/XL), AI Fit Confidence % badge, and an 'Add to Trial' button. Limit trial selection to a maximum of 5 items total — once 5 are selected, disable all remaining 'Add to Trial' buttons. Show a dynamic Trial Cart side panel listing selected items. Include a 'Send to Trial Hub' button in the Trial Cart that navigates to the Trial Hub page. If the user has completed a Body Scan and selects a size that doesn't match their recommended size, show a warning popup: 'This size may not fit you. Recommended: M'. If the user has completed a Wardrobe Scan and selects a product similar to an already-owned item, show a popup: 'You already own 5 pink tops. Are you sure you want another?'

quotes: Product grid: T-shirts, Jeans, Tops, Kurtas, Dresses
Fit Confidence %
Limit trial selection to maximum 5 items
Show dynamic Trial Cart panel on side
Send to Trial Hub → navigate to Trial Hub page
Show warning popup: 'This size may not fit you. Recommended: M'
Show popup: 'You already own 5 pink tops. Are you sure you want another?'

acceptanceCriteria: Product grid displays at least 10 items with category labels
Each card shows image, name, price, size selector, fit confidence badge, and Add to Trial button
After 5 items added, all remaining Add to Trial buttons are disabled with a visual indicator
Trial Cart side panel updates in real time as items are added
Send to Trial Hub button navigates to Trial Hub page and passes selected items
Size warning popup appears when a size mismatching the body scan recommendation is selected
Wardrobe duplicate ownership popup appears correctly based on wardrobe scan state

requirements.text: Build the Trial Hub Page that displays the up to 5 items selected from the Shop. Each item shows: product image, selected size, a 'Keep' button, and a 'Return' button. Clicking 'Keep' marks the item with a green highlight and 'Purchased' label with an animated confirmation effect. Clicking 'Return' marks the item with a red highlight and 'Returned' label with an animated confirmation effect. Use React component state to track each item's status (neutral / kept / returned).

quotes: Show selected items
Keep button → mark as Purchased (green highlight)
Return button → mark as Returned (red highlight)
Show animated confirmation

acceptanceCriteria: All selected trial items are displayed with image and size
Keep button turns card green with 'Purchased' label and plays a confirmation animation
Return button turns card red with 'Returned' label and plays a confirmation animation
Both buttons are disabled after a decision is made for that item
State persists within the session (not lost on navigation within the app)

requirements.text: Build the Body Scan AI Page with a simulated camera UI frame, an animated scanning overlay (e.g., pulsing scan line or ring effect), and a 'Start Scan' button. After clicking 'Start Scan', play a scan animation for a few seconds, then display detected body measurements: Shoulder, Chest, Waist, and Height (use realistic mock values). Display a recommended size result card: 'Your Ideal Size: M'. Store the recommended size in app state so the Shop page can use it to trigger size mismatch warnings.

quotes: Show camera UI simulation
Animated scanning overlay effect
Button: 'Start Scan'
Display detected measurements: Shoulder, Chest, Waist, Height
Show recommended size result: 'Your Ideal Size: M'
If user tries selecting wrong size later: Show warning popup

acceptanceCriteria: Camera frame UI renders with a realistic simulated feed area
Scan animation plays for at least 2-3 seconds after clicking Start Scan
After animation, measurement cards for Shoulder, Chest, Waist, and Height appear with values
Recommended size card clearly shows 'Your Ideal Size: M'
Recommended size is stored in global/shared state accessible by the Shop page

requirements.text: Build the Wardrobe AI Page with a simulated wardrobe scanning interface (animated camera frame or image upload zone). After triggering the scan, display an analytics dashboard showing: count of tops owned, count of jeans owned, and a color distribution chart (bar or donut chart) showing wardrobe color breakdown. Store wardrobe data in app state so the Shop page can check for duplicate item warnings (e.g., if the user already owns multiple items of the same category and color).

quotes: Simulated wardrobe scanning interface
Animated image upload or camera frame
Display analytics dashboard: Number of tops, Number of jeans, Color distribution chart
Show popup: 'You already own 5 pink tops. Are you sure you want another?'

acceptanceCriteria: Wardrobe scan interface renders with animated camera or upload zone
After scan trigger, analytics dashboard appears with tops count, jeans count, and color chart
Color distribution chart renders correctly with mock data (at least 4-5 colors)
Wardrobe state is stored globally and accessible by the Shop page for ownership warnings

requirements.text: Create a shared global app state (using React Context or React Query state) to store: (1) the trial cart items (max 5), (2) the body scan recommended size, (3) the wardrobe analytics data. This shared state must persist throughout the session and be accessible across the Shop, Trial Hub, Body Scan AI, and Wardrobe AI pages.

quotes: Use component states for: Added to trial, Kept, Returned, Size warning popup

acceptanceCriteria: Trial cart state is shared between Shop and Trial Hub pages
Body scan recommended size is accessible in Shop for warning popups
Wardrobe data is accessible in Shop for ownership duplicate warnings
State does not reset when navigating between pages within the session

requirements.text: Set up a basic Motoko backend actor that stores product catalog data (name, category, price, sizes, fit confidence %) and exposes query functions to retrieve product listings. The frontend should fetch products from this backend on the Shop page load.

quotes: Product grid: T-shirts, Jeans, Tops, Kurtas, Dresses
Each product card must show: Image, Name, Price, Size options, Fit Confidence %

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor stores at least 10 mock products with name, category, price, sizes array, and fitConfidence fields
Backend exposes a query function getProducts() that returns all products
Frontend Shop page calls getProducts() and renders the returned data
Products load correctly and display in the product grid

constraints: Use purple, neon blue, and pink as the primary color palette — do not deviate to other color schemes
Trial cart must be hard-limited to exactly 5 items maximum
All page navigation must use client-side routing (no full page reloads)
Body scan and wardrobe scan are simulated — no real camera API or file upload processing required
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Real camera or biometric body scanning
Actual payment processing or checkout flow
Backend persistence of trial cart, body scan, or wardrobe data
Integration with any external fashion or e-commerce APIs
